tasks.description: Verify Tech Stack npm packages and versions from PRD
success_criteria: Run: npm install phaser@3.80.1
Run: npm install vite@latest typescript@latest (replace @latest with the exact versions specified in the PRD Tech Stack if provided)

tasks.description: Initialize PixelMaze project scaffold with Vite + TypeScript and Phaser entrypoint
success_criteria: Repository builds and runs a Vite dev server without errors
TypeScript compilation succeeds with no type errors
Phaser game boots to a blank scene in the browser
tasks.output:
<ralph>COMPLETE</ralph>

## Task 2 Complete ✅

I successfully initialized the PixelMaze project scaffold with Vite + TypeScript and Phaser entrypoint. Here's what was implemented:

### ✅ Success Criteria Met:
- **Repository builds and runs a Vite dev server without errors** - Vite dev server starts successfully on localhost:5173
- **TypeScript compilation succeeds with no type errors** - `npx tsc --noEmit` passes with no errors  
- **Phaser game boots to a blank scene in the browser** - GameScen

tasks.description: Define core data model types and state container interfaces (GameState, HighScore, Settings, MazeData)
success_criteria: TypeScript types/interfaces exist for GameState, HighScore, Settings, MazeData
Relationships between entities match PRD (e.g., GameState references MazeData, Settings, scoring/timer fields)
Game state can be initialized to a valid default without runtime errors

tasks.description: Implement procedural 21x21 maze generation producing a valid solvable maze with required entities
success_criteria: Maze generator outputs a 21x21 grid consistently
Generated maze always has exactly one player start and one exit placed according to PRD rules
Generated maze is solvable (path exists from start to exit)
Coin placements follow PRD constraints (count/spacing/locations)
Error state handling matches PRD (e.g., if generation fails, show specified error message)

tasks.description: Create Phaser scenes structure: Boot/Preload, Main Menu, Game, Game Over/Win as needed per PRD
success_criteria: Scenes are separated and navigable via scene transitions
Main Menu scene shows exact UI copy from PRD
Starting a game transitions from Main Menu to Game scene reliably
Returning to menu/reset flows work without stale state

tasks.description: Implement UI/UX styling system (colors, typography, layout) per PRD
success_criteria: All specified hex colors are implemented and applied to the correct UI elements
Pixel font typography is loaded and used as specified
Desktop layout notes from PRD are reflected (positioning, spacing, alignment)
UI text strings exactly match PRD copy

tasks.description: Render maze grid and entities (walls/floor, player, coins, exit) with pixel-art appropriate scaling
success_criteria: Maze tiles render consistently and align to grid
Player, coin, and exit sprites/graphics render at correct positions
No visual gaps/overlaps at tile boundaries at typical desktop resolutions

tasks.description: Implement keyboard controls and smooth pixel movement with collision rules
success_criteria: Keyboard controls match PRD (exact keys)
Movement is smooth (not tile-jump) while still grid/collision constrained per PRD
Player cannot pass through walls; collision behavior matches acceptance checks
Input is ignored/handled correctly during win/lose transitions

tasks.description: Implement coin collection mechanics and scoring rules
success_criteria: Collecting a coin removes it from the maze and updates score immediately
Score calculation matches PRD rules exactly
HUD reflects updated coin/score values without delay
Attempting to collect already-collected coin does not change score (no double count)

tasks.description: Implement timer, win/lose conditions (exit reached / time expires), and end-state handling
success_criteria: Timer starts/stops per PRD (e.g., on game start, on end)
Reaching exit triggers win state with exact UI copy
Timer expiry triggers lose state with exact UI copy
Post-game actions (restart/menu) behave per PRD and reset state cleanly

tasks.description: Build HUD (score/coins/timer and any other PRD-specified indicators) with exact copy and colors
success_criteria: HUD shows all required fields (timer, score, coins, etc.)
HUD updates in real time and matches PRD styling (hex colors, font, placement)
HUD remains readable and correctly layered above gameplay

tasks.description: Implement camera behavior (initial framing and future-proof follow capability) per PRD
success_criteria: Camera shows the correct portion of the maze based on PRD (fixed or follow)
If follow is required: camera follows player smoothly without jitter
Camera bounds prevent showing outside the maze world

tasks.description: Persist high scores and settings locally according to data model
success_criteria: HighScore persists across page reloads (e.g., localStorage)
Settings persist across page reloads
Data migrations/validation prevent crashes on corrupted/old saved data (fallback to defaults)

tasks.description: Implement PRD-specified error states and user-facing messages across flows
success_criteria: All PRD-listed error messages are present with exact strings
Error conditions are reachable only when appropriate and recover gracefully
No uncaught exceptions during typical gameplay or reset flows

tasks.description: Acceptance verification against PRD success criteria and core feature checks
success_criteria: All 8 core features pass their acceptance checks
All 12 PRD success criteria are demonstrably met
Manual test pass: generate multiple mazes, complete level, collect coins, verify win/lose, verify UI copy/colors
